input.description: The name of the adapter to use to handle the request. Default adapter name: HPSCActor.

The items for the adapter request. This should be an XML document with a root element named "items" having a children "item" (to support multiple item support, we give "item" multiple times), which should contain the data necessary to execute the specific request.
Update Vendor
This wrapper updates Vendor record via the application. The application saves this record into its repository which can later be used.
Sample Item Xml:
<items> <item> <operation-name>update-vendor</operation-name> <model> <keys> <vendor-name> <value>MyVendorName10</value> <type>String</type> </vendor-name> <location> <value>location10</value> <type>String</type> </location> </keys> <instance> <vendor-name> <value>MyVendorName10</value> <type>String</type> </vendor-name> <location> <value>location10</value> <type>String</type> </location> <address> <type>Array</type> <address> <element> <value>Address</value> <type>String</type> </element> </address> </address> <city> <value>Noida-updated</value> <type>String</type> </city> <zip-code> <value>111111</value> <type>String</type> </zip-code> <sales-rep> <value>Sales Rep</value> <type>String</type> </sales-rep> <sales-manager> <value>Sales Manager</value> <type>String</type> </sales-manager> <sales-manager-phone> <value>Phone</value> <type>String</type> </sales-manager-phone> <service-contact> <value>Technician</value> <type>String</type> </service-contact> <service-phone> <value>Phone</value> <type>String</type> </service-phone> <after-hours-phone> <value>Phone</value> <type>String</type> </after-hours-phone> <open-time> <value>08:00:00</value> <type>Time</type> </open-time> <close-time> <value>09:00:00</value> <type>Time</type> </close-time> <sales-rep-phone> <value>Phone</value> <type>String</type> </sales-rep-phone> <country> <value>Country</value> <type>String</type> </country> <email> <value>Email</value> <type>String</type> </email> <vendor-i-d> <value>ID</value> <type>String</type> </vendor-i-d> <contract-number> <value>Contact No</value> <type>String</type> </contract-number> <contract-phone> <value>Phone</value> <type>String</type> </contract-phone> <order-person> <value>Order Contact</value> <type>String</type> </order-person> <order-phone> <value>Phone</value> <type>String</type> </order-phone> <contract-person> <value>Contact Person</value> <type>String</type> </contract-person> <URL> <value>URL</value> <type>String</type> </URL> <is-vendor> <value>true</value> <type>Boolean</type> </is-vendor> <is-manufacturer> <value>false</value> <type>Boolean</type> </is-manufacturer> <u-r-l> <value>u r l</value> <type>String</type> </u-r-l> </instance> </model> </item> </items> Elements’ Description:
Update Process takes place in following manner-
The record is first selected (located) by the information provided in the <keys> element. Essentially, you populate <keys> element with valid key elements otherwise the record wouldn’t be located.
Once the record is located properly, the fields are updated by the information provided in <instance> element. That is, the respective fields of located record are replaced by the elements’ values that are provided in <instance> element.
NOTE: While locating a record, complete matching of key is required. This means if you give key value to be “abc” and there is a record in the application repository which has key element as “abc123” then this record wouldn’t be located for the update (compare with Find Wrappers.)
Modification/Update in located record is done in following manner-
Suppose an random element with name <random-element> which has an 'fieldValue1'. i.e. on retrieving, we'll get.
<instance> ... ...
<random-element> <value>fieldValue1</value> <type>fieldType<type> </random-element> ... ... </instance>
Now see following cases of updation-
Case-1: <instance> </instance>
i.e., we don't provide even the element <random-element> Result: the field get ignored, i.e. not updated.
Case-2: <instance> <random-element> <value></value> <type>fieldType<type> </random-element> </instance>
i.e., we don't provide anything inside <value> element (child of element <random-element>.) Result: the field get ignored, i.e. not updated.
Case-3: <instance> <random-element> <value> </value> <type>fieldType<type> </random-element> </instance>
i.e., we provide an space character " " (or more contiguous space characters, like " ") inside <value> element (child of element <random-element>.) Result: the field get's updated, and the field <random-elements> is set to blank ""(compare with space character " ".)
Case-4: <instance> <random-element> <value>fieldValue2</value> <type>fieldType<type> </random-element> </instance>
i.e., we provide "fieldValue2" inside <value> element (child of element <random-element>.) Result: the value "fieldValue2" is set to field of <random-element>.
NOTE: One can update the key elements too.
Complete Elements’ Description:
item [Required]: This is a child of <items>. This <item> tag can be multiple times to support "multiple items support".
operation-name [Required]:
This shows, what operation you want to perform.
Valid values: <operation-name>update-vendor</operation-name> is valid operation name element.
keys [Required]: used to ask application to search for the record with the elements inside it.
Instance [Required] : It can have many children. The children of this element describe fields of a record.
Vendor-name[Optional]: The name of the vendor.
Name of this element in the application: General > Name.
Valid Value: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Location[Optional]: The location information.
Name of this element in the application: Location > Location.
Valid Values: Any string, or you can select existing location record from the application repository.
Default Value: Ignored.
City[Optional]: The city name.
Name of this element in the application: Location > Second field of Address.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Zip-code [Optional]: the zip code related to address.
Name of this element in the application: Location > 5th field of Address.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Sales-rep[Optional]: Sales rep. information.
Name of this field in the application: Sales > Sales Rep.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Sales-manager[Optional]: The sales manager.
Name of this element in the application: Sales > Sales Manager.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Sales-manager-phone[Optional]: The phone number of the sales manager.
Name of this element in the application: Sales > Phone (below the sales manager field)
Valid values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Service-contact[Optional]: The service contact.
Name of this element in the application: Service > Technician.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Values: Ignored.
Service-phone[Optional]: The service contact number.
Name of this element in the application: Service > phone.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
After-hours-phone[Optional]: The contact during off work.
Name of this element in the application: Service > Phone (below after hours contact)
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Values: Ignored.
Open-time [Optional]: The open time for services.
Name of this element in the application: Service > Hours (1st field)
Valid Values: Any input in ‘Time’ format.
Time format: HH:MM:SS HH -> hour MM -> min SS -> second
Default Value: Ignored.
Close-time [Optional]: The close time for services.
Name of this element in the application: Service > Hours (2nd field)
Valid Values: Any input in ‘Time’ format.
Time format: HH:MM:SS HH -> hour MM -> min SS -> second
Default Value: Ignored.
sales-rep-phone [Optional]: The phone number of sales Rep.
Name of this element in the application: Service > Phone (Below Sales Rep.)
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Country [Optional]: The country name.
Name of this element in the application: Location > Country.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Email [Optional]: The email address.
Name of this element in the application: Location > Email.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Vendor-i-d [Optional]: The vendor ID.
Name of this field in the application: General > ID.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Contact-number [Optional]: Vendor’s contact number.
Name of this element in the application: General > Phone (second column bottom)
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Order-person [Optional]: The name of order person.
Name of this element in the application: General > Order Contact.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Order-phone [Optional]: The phone number of order.
Name of this element in the application: General > Phone (second column second row)
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Contract-person [Optional]: The contract person.
Name of this field in the application: General > Contract Person.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
URL[Optional]: The url.
Name of this element in the application: (NOT writable) the url
It refers to <u-r-l>.
Is-vendor [Optional]:
Name of this element in the application: Location > Is Vendor (Radio Button).
Valid Values: true/ false.
True -> vendor, False -> not vendor.
Default Value: false.
Is-manufacturer [Optional]:
Name of this element in the application: Location > Is Manufacturer (Radio Button).
Valid Values: true/ false.
Default Value: false.
u-r-l [Optional]: the url for the record.
Name of this element in the application: General URL.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Values: Ignored.

Provide username/password in form of xml.
This input parameter is required when the user wants to override the default values for username and password provided in the adapter configuration. This is required for cases where an operation cannot be executed with the default username/password provided in the adapter configuration and only user with special permissions can execute the operation. Examples of such operations can be - 'approve-change', 'deny-change', 'close-change', 'approve-task'
Sample XML Format:
<connection-parameters> <alternate-username>USERNAME</alternate-username> <alternate-password>PASSWORD</alternate-password> </connection-parameters>
